title.value: Inferring dynamic regulatory interaction graphs from time series data with perturbations
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly indicated at the beginning.
title.quote: Inferring dynamic regulatory interaction graphs from time series data with perturbations

extractions.description: This paper presents Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI), a method for inferring time-varying interaction graphs in complex systems using a combination of space-and-time graph attentions and graph neural ordinary differential equations. RiTINI is evaluated on various simulated and real-world datasets.

type.justification: The paper evaluates the performance of RiTINI on various datasets, which is typical of empirical research.
type.quote: We evaluate RiTINI’s performance on various simulated and real-world datasets, demonstrating its state-of-the-art capability in inferring interaction graphs compared to previous methods.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on inferring dynamic regulatory interaction graphs using graph-based neural network methods.
name.quote:
In this paper, we
propose Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI) for inferring
time-varying interaction graphs in complex systems using a novel combination of
space-and-time graph attentions and graph neural ordinary differential equations
(ODEs).

name.justification: The paper applies RiTINI to infer interaction graphs in neural networks.
name.quote: We show that our method is competitive in a variety of real-world problems such as neurology (recovery of neuronal networks)

name.justification: The paper applies RiTINI to infer gene regulatory networks.
name.quote:
and molecular biology (recovery of gene regulatory
networks)

name.justification: The model proposed in the paper is called Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI).
name.quote:
In this paper, we propose Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI) for inferring
time-varying interaction graphs in complex systems using a novel combination of
space-and-time graph attentions and graph neural ordinary differential equations
(ODEs).

is_contributed.justification: RiTINI is the main contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we propose Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI)

is_executed.justification: The model was executed to evaluate its performance on various datasets.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate RiTINI’s performance on various simulated and real-world datasets

is_compared.justification: The paper compares RiTINI's performance with other existing methods.
is_compared.quote:
We compare the performance of
RiTINI in the graph inference task by comparing with other well known methods for
static graph inference

referenced_paper_title.value: Inferring dynamic regulatory interaction graphs from time series data with perturbations
referenced_paper_title.justification: Since RiTINI is a new model proposed in this paper, the reference title remains from the same paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
In this paper, we propose Regulatory Temporal Interaction Network Inference (RiTINI) for inferring
time-varying interaction graphs in complex systems using a novel combination of
space-and-time graph attentions and graph neural ordinary differential equations
(ODEs).

name.value: Neuronal Network Simulation Data from NEST
name.justification: The neuronal network data was generated using NEST for evaluating RiTINI.
name.quote: We showcase results on neuronal simulation data obtained using NEST

referenced_paper_title.justification: The NEST simulator is used for generating the neuronal network data.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
NEST (Neural Simulation Tool), developed by Sinha et al. [44], is a platform that offers a flexible and
efficient approach for modeling and studying the behavior of various neuronal networks, particularly
in the context of large-scale simulations.

name.value: Gene Regulatory Network Simulation Data from SERGIO
name.justification: The gene regulatory network data was generated using SERGIO for evaluating RiTINI.
name.quote:
gene regulatory simulation
data from SERGIO

referenced_paper_title.value: SERGIO: a Single-Cell Expression Simulator Guided by Gene Regulatory Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The SERGIO simulator is used for generating the gene regulatory network data.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
We used SERGIO (Single-Cell Expression Simulator Guided by Gene Regulatory Networks) [16], a tool
developed by Dibaeinia and Sinha to simulate gene regulatory networks (GRNs).

name.justification: The NEST simulator was used to generate neuronal network simulation data.
name.quote: We showcase results on neuronal simulation data obtained using NEST

referenced_paper_title.justification: The NEST simulator is referenced as NEST 3.4 in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
NEST (Neural Simulation Tool), developed by Sinha et al. [44], is a platform that offers a flexible and
efficient approach for modeling and studying the behavior of various neuronal networks, particularly
in the context of large-scale simulations.

name.justification: The SERGIO simulator was used to generate gene regulatory network simulation data.
